001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Entity;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.activations.ActivationFunction;
006
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.
012 * <p>
013 * A {@code Neuron} receives inputs from other neurons, combines them
014 * using a weighted sum plus a bias, and passes the result (the "logit")
015 * through an {@link ActivationFunction} to produce its output.
016 * </p>
017 *
018 * <h2>Computation</h2>
019 * For a neuron with inputs {@code x₁ … xₙ}, weights {@code w₁ … wₙ},
020 * and bias {@code b}, the forward activation is:
021 * <pre>
022 *   logit = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
023 *   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)
024 * </pre>
025 *
026 * <h2>Lifecycle</h2>
027 * <ul>
028 *   <li>Before activation, the neuron has no valid {@code logit} or {@code output}.</li>
029 *   <li>{@link #activate()} computes the neuron’s output, caching
030 *       the logit and activation result and marking it as "activated".</li>
031 *   <li>{@link #deactivate()} resets the activation flag, allowing the neuron
032 *       to be re-evaluated (e.g., for another forward pass).</li>
033 *   <li>{@link #getLogit()} and {@link #getOutput()} may only be called
034 *       after activation.</li>
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <h2>Thread safety</h2>
038 * <ul>
039 *   <li>Activation and deactivation are synchronized to prevent race conditions
040 *       in concurrent evaluation.</li>
041 *   <li>Weight and bias setters are not synchronized; concurrent modification
042 *       must be managed externally if required.</li>
043 * </ul>
044 */
045@DomainObject
046@Entity
047public class Neuron {
048
049    private final String name;
050    private final List<? extends Neuron> inputs;
051    private float[] weights;
052    private float bias;
053    /**
054     * Linear combination of inputs before activation.
055     */
056    protected float logit;
057    private final ActivationFunction activationFunction;
058    /**
059     * Cached output after applying the activation function.
060     */
061    protected float output;
062    /**
063     * Flag indicating whether {@link #activate()} has been called.
064     */
065    protected boolean activated;
066
067    /**
068     * Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
069     *
070     * @param name               human-readable identifier
071     * @param inputs             input neurons (empty if none)
072     * @param activationFunction function to apply to the weighted sum
073     */
074    public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
075        this.name = name;
076        this.inputs = inputs == null ? List.of() : inputs;
077        this.weights = new float[this.inputs.size()];
078        this.activationFunction = activationFunction;
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * @return the human-readable identifier of this neuron
083     */
084    public String getName() {
085        return name;
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * @return the input neurons feeding into this neuron
090     */
091    public List<? extends Neuron> getInputs() {
092        return inputs;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * @return the activation function applied to the weighted sum
097     */
098    public ActivationFunction getActivationFunction() {
099        return activationFunction;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Computes the logit and output of this neuron by aggregating inputs,
104     * applying weights and bias, and passing the result through the
105     * activation function. Subsequent calls are ignored until
106     * {@link #deactivate()} is invoked.
107     */
108    public synchronized void activate() {
109        if (isActivated()) {
110            return;
111        }
112        logit = bias;
113        for (int i = 0; i < inputs.size(); i++) {
114            float input = inputs.get(i).getOutput();
115            logit += input * weights[i];
116        }
117        output = activationFunction.activate(logit);
118        activated = true;
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * @return whether this neuron has been activated
123     */
124    public boolean isActivated() {
125        return activated;
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.
130     */
131    public synchronized void deactivate() {
132        activated = false;
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * @return the trainable weights of this neuron
137     */
138    public float[] getWeights() {
139        return weights;
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Sets the trainable weights of this neuron.
144     */
145    public void setWeights(float[] weights) {
146        this.weights = weights;
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * @return the trainable bias of this neuron
151     */
152    public float getBias() {
153        return bias;
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Sets the trainable bias of this neuron.
158     */
159    public void setBias(float bias) {
160        this.bias = bias;
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Returns the pre-activation weighted sum of inputs.
165     *
166     * @return the computed logit
167     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
168     */
169    public float getLogit() {
170        if (!isActivated()) {
171            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
172        }
173        return logit;
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
178     *
179     * @return the activated output value
180     * @throws IllegalStateException if the neuron has not been activated
181     */
182    public float getOutput() {
183        if (!isActivated()) {
184            throw new IllegalStateException("Neuron not activated!");
185        }
186        return output;
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
191     *
192     * @param source the input neuron
193     * @return the corresponding weight, or {@code null} if not found
194     */
195    public Float findWeight(Neuron source) {
196        for (int i = 0; i < inputs.size(); i++) {
197            if (inputs.get(i) == source) {
198                return weights[i];
199            }
200        }
201        return null;
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * @return string representation including name, activation state, logit, output, weights, and bias
206     */
207    @Override
208    public String toString() {
209        return name + "{" + activated + ", " + logit + ", " + output + "}" + Arrays.toString(weights) + (bias >= 0.0 ? "+" : "") + bias;
210    }
211
212}
